title: Understanding the Role of Behavior Analysts
text: Board Certified Behavior Analysts (BCBAs) are professionals who specialize in behavior analysis. They work with individuals to improve their behavior through various interventions. But what exactly do they do?

title: Key Responsibilities of BCBAs
text: BCBAs are responsible for designing and implementing behavior intervention plans. They use data-driven methods to assess and modify behavior. Can you identify which option best describes their role?

hintAnswer: they implement a process of systemically applying interventions to modify an individual's behavior and at the same time collecting data to evaluate the effect of each intervention on the individual's behavior
title: Identifying the Correct Role
text: Which of the following best describes the role of a Board Certified Behavior Analyst?
choices: they implement a process of systemically applying interventions to modify an individual's behavior and at the same time collecting data to evaluate the effect of each intervention on the individual's behavior
they work with students with ASD on a variety of activities, providing valuable insight into the student's strengths, areas of needs, interests, and other issues
they develop and monitor appropriate feeding plans to address the nutritional needs of the child, as well as other feeding issues such as food preferences, food habits, and sensory issues
